ygData.subject: Re: For you...
ygData.msgSnippet: I wouldn t say I tried to pin it on you, did I flame when you directly insulted God, no I just said I ll pray for you.  I will not be luke warm  I will

I wouldn't say I tried to pin it on you, did I flame
when you directly insulted God, no I just said I'll
pray for you.  I will not be "luke warm"  I will
declare God until I die because that's what Jesus
taught us to do.

--- Hollywood Narrator Anarchy <thecode@...>
wrote:
> OOC: I apologize if it seems like I am flooding the
> group with OOC's. I just had to get my point across.
> 
> My mails replying to Cardhead were giving him a 
> taste of his own medicine.
> 
> My posts replying to Dewboy was complaining that
> right and complaining about him trying to pin his
> religion on me.
> 
> And overall I think NBW has unfortunately turned
> into a mere shadow of the great RPG it once was.
> 
> I just now come to realize that if I'm not welcome
> here, I'll gladly leave. I've been up and down that
> lonely road of faith. DBZSF for me means that my
> RPGing skills are never wasted.
> 
> There was a time when all of my characters were
> serious. They all had very deep personalities. But
> those days are long gone, it appears, thanks to the
> character limit. The character limit of 5 prevents
> me from being able to do what I do best, right.
> Yeah, I know my stables were bad, but some great
> individual characters came out of it sometimes,
> correct? My unwillingness to return to my past are
> because it feels to me NBW is just no more fun. I
> have really tried to post. I wanted to help it. But
> apparently the new guy thinks he's a more valuable
> player than me. It's no wonder the RPG is dying.
> Look here. New guy comes in and posts and Cardhead
> will attack him and run him off. You can look
> forward to that in the future.
> 
> I hope you all enjoyed my explanation mail.
> 
> The world is ******...
